moves.1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 e6 3. Nc3 Nc6 4. Bc4 g6: Some of you may like 8...f6 better, but I just chose to play this.
moves.9. Bh4 Nd4 10. Nxd4 cxd4 11. Ne2 g5: I still want more room for my pieces. However, this is the beginning of my doom...
moves.13. exd5 Nxd5 14. Bxd5 Qxd5 15. c4 dxc3: This seems to be the only way to equalize.
moves.16. Nxc3 Qa5 17. d4: Yes, now white stands on top but I wasn't going to accept that!
moves.17... e5: ?! This weakens my king's position. Maybe a quieter move like 17...b6 or 17...Bd7 would have been better.
moves.18... Bxe5: May not even be best, as suddenly I am losing after 4 more moves.
moves.20... Qc7: ? This allows white to get some initiative with 21.Nd5!.
moves.21... Qa5: This avoids 21...Qd6 22.Ne7+, but I am still not in too pretty of a position.
moves.22... Kg7 23. Qd4+ Kh7: ? Well now I should have took the gusto with 23...f6.
moves.24. Re5: ! This pawn sac is sound. White really wins now.
moves.24... Qxa2 25. Rc1 Be6 26. h3: ? Now white's attack is beginning to stall. White had a better try, namely 26.h4!, for when black is sooner or later going to be mated.
moves.26... Rfe8 27. Rc7 Rad8: Now, things are beginning to come back to me. However black's position is still ugly.
moves.30. Qxf5 Rxe5: May not be best, but I couldn't see anything better. The queen must stay on the a2-f7 diagonal.
moves.31. Qxe5+ Kg8 32. Qf6: I was expecting 32.Qe7, but my response did not change.
moves.32... Rd1+ 33. Kh2 Qe6: This is the only way to not go into an endgame a pawn down. However, I am actually getting a draw!
moves.34. Qxe6 fxe6 35. Rxb7 Rd2 36. f3: I don't understand this move, but who cares?
moves.36... a5 37. Ra7 Rxb2 38. Rxa5 Kf7 39. K: Why white played this move, I don't know either. But I had an adequate response.
moves.40... Rb6:
This defends the 6-th rank, the rank where most of my pawns are. The endgame is drawn. 

(Result:1/2-1/2)
